item.title: [Request] RSCD_V25 No-forums
item.dc:creator: @_Riley1 ☺Riley☺
item.description:
@_Riley1 wrote:

[quote=“dimebagx, post:8, topic:344591”]Oh true,
It’s just that we can’t get fast internet where we are so i’d rather not have to download all of
the extras ect

I’ve been going through RSCDEF and stuff like that, it’s way too hard for me to understand tbh,
I think I need to understand how everything works first, how the client/server interacts so
I can implement simple stuff and learn how each part works and so on.[/quote]
Slow internet is failed, I’ve put up with it until finally our community formed a contract with a provider to get some better internet out here…few months from now <3.

OT: I suggest you follow some java tutorials, they lead you in slowly so you understand (IF you follow them!) what is going on. Just looking through a RSC source will not teach you very much. I also suggest watching some of Mehran Sahami’s videos on youtube.

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] RSCD_V25 No-forums
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

dimebagx:

Is there anyway to run these servers without xamplite?

The only reason for the database is to load and save data from when players log in and out. You can modify the code to load a player from the server configuration XML file if you wanted to. It would take a little bit to chop and hack the log-in server out of the source but it’s entirely doable.

You’ll find a PlayerLogin handler in the server section that will fire when the client sends a login packet. You can simply find what happens when the login server should have responded and emulate that manually as it’s only String and numeric data, really. A similar tactic can be done with the client itself in order to just walk around on the client without having a server. It’s just cutting out the middleman

Client -> Login Packet -> Server -> Login Server -> validate login -> Return Packet -> Server -> Client
-to-
Client -> Login Packet (won’t be validated) -> Server -> Client

Read full topic
